00027 typedef b3AlignedObjectArray<b3BroadphasePair>  b3BroadphasePairArray;
00028 
00029 struct  b3OverlapCallback
00030 {
00031         virtual ~b3OverlapCallback()
00032         {}
00033         //return true for deletion of the pair
00034         virtual bool    processOverlap(b3BroadphasePair& pair) = 0;
00035 
00036 };
00037 
00038 struct b3OverlapFilterCallback
00039 {
00040         virtual ~b3OverlapFilterCallback()
00041         {}
00042         // return true when pairs need collision
00043         virtual bool    needBroadphaseCollision(int proxy0,int proxy1) const = 0;
00044 };

00056 const int B3_NULL_PAIR=0xffffffff;

00060 class b3OverlappingPairCache 
00061 {

00074

00076

00078

00080

00082

00084 
00085         //virtual       void    setInternalGhostPairCallback(b3OverlappingPairCallback* ghostPairCallback)=0;
00086

00089         virtual void    removeOverlappingPairsContainingProxy(int /*proxy0*/,b3Dispatcher* /*dispatcher*/)=0;
00090 
00091         virtual void    sortOverlappingPairs(b3Dispatcher* dispatcher) = 0;

00097 class b3HashedOverlappingPairCache : public b3OverlappingPairCache
00098 {
00099         b3BroadphasePairArray   m_overlappingPairArray;
00100         b3OverlapFilterCallback* m_overlapFilterCallback;
00101 //      bool            m_blockedForChanges;
00102 
00103 
00104 public:
00105         b3HashedOverlappingPairCache();
00106         virtual ~b3HashedOverlappingPairCache();
00107 
00108         
00109         virtual void    removeOverlappingPairsContainingProxy(int proxy,b3Dispatcher* dispatcher);
00110 
00111         virtual void*   removeOverlappingPair(int proxy0,int proxy1,b3Dispatcher* dispatcher);
00112         
00113         B3_FORCE_INLINE bool needsBroadphaseCollision(int proxy0,int proxy1) const
00114         {
00115                 if (m_overlapFilterCallback)
00116                         return m_overlapFilterCallback->needBroadphaseCollision(proxy0,proxy1);
00117 
00118                 bool collides = true;//(proxy0->m_collisionFilterGroup & proxy1->m_collisionFilterMask) != 0;
00119                 //collides = collides && (proxy1->m_collisionFilterGroup & proxy0->m_collisionFilterMask);
00120                 
00121                 return collides;
00122         }
00123 
00124         // Add a pair and return the new pair. If the pair already exists,
00125         // no new pair is created and the old one is returned.
00126         virtual b3BroadphasePair*       addOverlappingPair(int proxy0,int proxy1)
00127         {
00128                 b3g_addedPairs++;
00129 
00130                 if (!needsBroadphaseCollision(proxy0,proxy1))
00131                         return 0;
00132 
00133                 return internalAddPair(proxy0,proxy1);
00134         }
00135 
00136         
00137 
00138         void    cleanProxyFromPairs(int proxy,b3Dispatcher* dispatcher);
00139 
00140         
00141         virtual void    processAllOverlappingPairs(b3OverlapCallback*,b3Dispatcher* dispatcher);
00142 
00143         virtual b3BroadphasePair*       getOverlappingPairArrayPtr()
00144         {
00145                 return &m_overlappingPairArray[0];
00146         }
00147 
00148         const b3BroadphasePair* getOverlappingPairArrayPtr() const
00149         {
00150                 return &m_overlappingPairArray[0];
00151         }
00152 
00153         b3BroadphasePairArray&  getOverlappingPairArray()
00154         {
00155                 return m_overlappingPairArray;
00156         }
00157

00159         {
00160                 return m_overlappingPairArray;
00161         }

00164

00168 
00169         int GetCount() const { return m_overlappingPairArray.size(); }
00170 //      b3BroadphasePair* GetPairs() { return m_pairs; }
00171

00173         {
00174                 return m_overlapFilterCallback;
00175         }
00176

00178         {
00179                 m_overlapFilterCallback = callback;
00180         }
00181 
00182         int     getNumOverlappingPairs() const
00183         {
00184                 return m_overlappingPairArray.size();
00185         }
00186 private:
00187         
00188         b3BroadphasePair*       internalAddPair(int proxy0,int proxy1);
00189 
00190         void    growTables();
00191 
00192         B3_FORCE_INLINE bool equalsPair(const b3BroadphasePair& pair, int proxyId1, int proxyId2)
00193         {       
00194                 return pair.x == proxyId1 && pair.y  == proxyId2;
00195         }
00196 
00197         /*
00198         // Thomas Wang's hash, see: http://www.concentric.net/~Ttwang/tech/inthash.htm
00199         // This assumes proxyId1 and proxyId2 are 16-bit.
00200         B3_FORCE_INLINE int getHash(int proxyId1, int proxyId2)
00201         {
00202                 int key = (proxyId2 << 16) | proxyId1;
00203                 key = ~key + (key << 15);
00204                 key = key ^ (key >> 12);
00205                 key = key + (key << 2);
00206                 key = key ^ (key >> 4);
00207                 key = key * 2057;
00208                 key = key ^ (key >> 16);
00209                 return key;
00210         }
00211         */
00212 
00213 
00214         
00215         B3_FORCE_INLINE unsigned int getHash(unsigned int proxyId1, unsigned int proxyId2)
00216         {
00217                 int key = static_cast<int>(((unsigned int)proxyId1) | (((unsigned int)proxyId2) <<16));
00218                 // Thomas Wang's hash
00219 
00220                 key += ~(key << 15);
00221                 key ^=  (key >> 10);
00222                 key +=  (key << 3);
00223                 key ^=  (key >> 6);
00224                 key += ~(key << 11);
00225                 key ^=  (key >> 16);
00226                 return static_cast<unsigned int>(key);
00227         }
00228         
00229 
00230 
00231 
00232 
00233         B3_FORCE_INLINE b3BroadphasePair* internalFindPair(int proxy0, int proxy1, int hash)
00234         {
00235                 int proxyId1 = proxy0;
00236                 int proxyId2 = proxy1;
00237                 #if 0 // wrong, 'equalsPair' use unsorted uids, copy-past devil striked again. Nat.
00238                 if (proxyId1 > proxyId2) 
00239                         b3Swap(proxyId1, proxyId2);
00240                 #endif
00241 
00242                 int index = m_hashTable[hash];
00243                 
00244                 while( index != B3_NULL_PAIR && equalsPair(m_overlappingPairArray[index], proxyId1, proxyId2) == false)
00245                 {
00246                         index = m_next[index];
00247                 }
00248 
00249                 if ( index == B3_NULL_PAIR )
00250                 {
00251                         return NULL;
00252                 }
00253 
00254                 b3Assert(index < m_overlappingPairArray.size());
00255 
00256                 return &m_overlappingPairArray[index];
00257         }
00258 
00259         virtual bool    hasDeferredRemoval()
00260         {
00261                 return false;
00262         }
00263 
00264 /*      virtual void    setInternalGhostPairCallback(b3OverlappingPairCallback* ghostPairCallback)
00265         {
00266                 m_ghostPairCallback = ghostPairCallback;
00267         }
00268         */
00269 
00270         virtual void    sortOverlappingPairs(b3Dispatcher* dispatcher);
00271         
00272 
00273 protected:
00274         
00275         b3AlignedObjectArray<int>       m_hashTable;
00276         b3AlignedObjectArray<int>       m_next;
00277 //      b3OverlappingPairCallback*      m_ghostPairCallback;
00278         
00279 };

00286 class   b3SortedOverlappingPairCache : public b3OverlappingPairCache
00287 {
00288         protected:
00289                 //avoid brute-force finding all the time
00290                 b3BroadphasePairArray   m_overlappingPairArray;
00291 
00292                 //during the dispatch, check that user doesn't destroy/create proxy
00293                 bool            m_blockedForChanges;
00294 
00296                 bool            m_hasDeferredRemoval;
00297                 
00298                 //if set, use the callback instead of the built in filter in needBroadphaseCollision
00299                 b3OverlapFilterCallback* m_overlapFilterCallback;
00300 
00301 //              b3OverlappingPairCallback*      m_ghostPairCallback;
00302 
00303         public:
00304

00306                 virtual ~b3SortedOverlappingPairCache();

00317

00321                 virtual void    removeOverlappingPairsContainingProxy(int proxy,b3Dispatcher* dispatcher);
00322 
00323 
00324                 inline bool needsBroadphaseCollision(int proxy0,int proxy1) const
00325                 {
00326                         if (m_overlapFilterCallback)
00327                                 return m_overlapFilterCallback->needBroadphaseCollision(proxy0,proxy1);
00328 
00329                         bool collides = true;//(proxy0->m_collisionFilterGroup & proxy1->m_collisionFilterMask) != 0;
00330                         //collides = collides && (proxy1->m_collisionFilterGroup & proxy0->m_collisionFilterMask);
00331                         
00332                         return collides;
00333                 }
00334                 
00335                 b3BroadphasePairArray&  getOverlappingPairArray()
00336                 {
00337                         return m_overlappingPairArray;
00338                 }
00339 
00340                 const b3BroadphasePairArray&    getOverlappingPairArray() const
00341                 {
00342                         return m_overlappingPairArray;
00343                 }

00345

00349                 {
00350                         return &m_overlappingPairArray[0];
00351                 }

00354                 {
00355                         return &m_overlappingPairArray[0];
00356                 }

00359                 {
00360                         return m_overlappingPairArray.size();
00361                 }

00364                 {
00365                         return m_overlapFilterCallback;
00366                 }

00369                 {
00370                         m_overlapFilterCallback = callback;
00371                 }

00374                 {
